<!--Add a news post - Rabies conference -->
<p id="2019.03.18"></p>
<div class="leftcard">
<h2>RITM Rabies Conference</h2>
<h5><em> 18th March, 2019 | Manila, Philippines</em></h5>
<!--Add an image-->
<div class="img_container">
<a href="proj_gallery.html#GM_gallery" class="moveTo">
<img src="img/gallery/rabies_conf_2019_2.jpg" class="img_link">
<div class="img_overlay">Go to Gallery</div>
</a>
</div>
<!--Add text-->
Dr. Mary Elizabeth Miranda, CEO of FETPAFI, is one of the speakers in the 2019 Rabies Conference, with the theme "Updates on Rabies Research, Diagnosis and Guidelines". <br>
She will cover 2 presentations, namely: 
<ol>
<li>Field Epidemiology and Outbreak Investigations for Rabies </li>
<li>Surveillance Integrating Phylogenetics and Epidemiology for Elimination of Disease: Evaluation of Rabies Control in the Philippines (SPEEDIER)</li>
</ol>

<!--Add a news post - Governor meeting-->
<p id="2019.03.05"></p>
<div class="leftcard">
<h2>Governor meeting</h2>
<h5><em> 5th March, 2019</em></h5>
<!--Add an image-->
<div class="img_container">
<a href="proj_gallery.html#GM_gallery" class="moveTo">
<img src="img/gallery/governor_1.png" class="img_link">
<div class="img_overlay">Go to Gallery</div>
</a>
</div>
<!--Add text-->
SPEEDIER (Surveillance Integrating Phylogenetics and Epidemiology for Elimination 
of Disease: Evaluation of Rabies Control in the Philippines) is a 3-year project 
of FETPAFI in collaboration with University of Glasgow, DOST-Philippine Council 
for Health Research and Development, Research Institute for Tropical Medicine and 
Department of Health. <br>
This multi-million project aims to deliver a cost-effective, epidemiologically 
robust, enhanced surveillance and response package to guide and sustain the 
elimination of RABIES from the Philippines.
